title: I grew up in the Westboro Baptist Church. Here's why I left - Megan Phelps-Roper

title: Claws vs. Nails - Matthew Borths

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary difference between the keratin coverings of claws and nails?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To produce keratin for nails and claws

options.label: B
options.text: They provide a rigid surface to press against

options.label: C
options.text: They make it easier to climb trees

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They make it easier to create and wield complex tools

options.label: B

options.label: B

title: How close are we to uploading our minds? - Michael S. A. Graziano

options.label: D

title: Hawking's black hole paradox explained - Fabio Pacucci

multiple-choice.question: What is the paradox that threatens to unravel the fields of general relativity and quantum mechanics?
What type of information are physicists concerned with in the context of quantum mechanics?
According to the law of conservation of information, what happens to the quantum information of an object when it is destroyed?

options.label: C
options.text: It is encoded on the surface of a black hole

multiple-choice.question: What is the surface of a black hole that marks the point of no return around it?

options.label: B
options.text: The surface of a black hole

options.label: C
options.text: The center of a black hole

options.label: D
options.text: The point of maximum gravity around a black hole

multiple-choice.question: What phenomenon discovered by Stephen Hawking shows that black holes are gradually evaporating?
What happens to the information encoded on the surface of a black hole as it evaporates, according to the phenomenon discovered by Stephen Hawking?

options.label: C
options.text: It is encoded on the surface of another black hole

options.label: D
options.text: It is unrelated to the information the black hole encodes

multiple-choice.question: What is the holographic principle?

options.label: A
options.text: The idea that the 2D surface of an event horizon can store quantum information

options.label: B
options.text: The idea that the 3D surface of a black hole can store quantum information

options.label: C
options.text: The idea that the boundary of the observable universe is a 2D surface encoded with information about real, 3D objects

options.label: D
options.text: The idea that the center of a black hole is a 2D surface encoded with information about real, 3D objects

multiple-choice.question: What is a unified theory of everything?

options.label: A
options.text: A theory that combines general relativity and quantum mechanics

options.label: B
options.text: A theory that combines quantum field theory and general relativity

options.label: C
options.text: A theory that explains everything about the universe

options.label: D
options.text: A theory that combines all fundamental forces of nature

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the black hole information paradox?

options.label: A
options.text: It threatens to undermine everything we know about the universe

options.label: B
options.text: It has already helped us take another step into the unknown

options.label: C
options.text: It has forced us to rewrite some of our most fundamental scientific paradigms

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential outcome of resolving the black hole information paradox?

options.label: A
options.text: It will lead to a complete understanding of the universe

options.label: B
options.text: It will open up new questions to explore

options.label: C
options.text: It will preserve our current models of the universe

options.label: D
options.text: It will prove that our current models of the universe are wrong

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept that suggests that the total amount of quantum information in the universe must be conserved?

options.label: A
options.text: The law of conservation of energy

options.label: B
options.text: The law of conservation of momentum

options.label: C
options.text: The law of conservation of information

options.label: D
options.text: The law of conservation of matter

What is the potential outcome of resolving the black hole information paradox, according to some theories?

options.label: A
options.text: It will lead to a complete understanding of the universe

options.label: B
options.text: It will open up new questions to explore

options.label: C
options.text: It will preserve our current models of the universe

options.label: D
options.text: It will prove that our current models of the universe are wrong
